result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Lamont Weston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape while under Extended Supervision, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(2m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence now serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any vocational, employment or education programming deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Lamont Weston

2 pm Def in court via video conferenc.  Atty Meredith Davis.  Justine L. Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Suleski sites plea agreement.  We'll be asking for a PSI.  Court discusses plea and PSI to Mr. Weston.  Mr. Weston is in agreement.
Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
Felony Escape While Under Extended Supervision  GUILTY   Rights/elements questions gone over.  No firearms or voting advised.
COURT finds the plea is F, V & I made.  Factual basis.  Found guilty and convicted.

PSI Due in 6 weeks; 1 week before sentencing.  SENT HRG in early May.

10:04 AM  - Def in court w/ Atty S. Joseph Randtke.  Def in custody.  Justine L. Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
RANDTKE: I filed a request to w/draw at my clients request then he changed his mind and wanted to keep me now he has decided he would like me to w/draw. If allowed, I will contact the SPD.  CRT: I understand that differences have surfaced and you are asking for another atty to be appt. That will result in a delay in the case. DEF: I am asking that he w/draw.CRT: will find that it's the def's request that Randtke w/draw as counsel. This will be ref'd back to the SPD office to assign other counsel.
